section.title: Stroke Width
section.p: Changes the stroke characteristics of the line to be draw. SVG works on the principle of a pen that draws on the canvas, changing the thickness of the pen stroke will not only be used by the line tool, but also all of the shape tools, as its outline. For example if the circle tool is selected, the outline of the circle will use the pen stroke width which has been set.

A dropdown list of widths are available. If 0 is chosen then shapes will not have an outline, but could still have a fill. If a line or an arrow is drawn with a width of 0, then nothing will be displayed.

section.title: Stroke Type
section.p: This allows for dotted or dashed outlines or lines to be drawn. A dropdown list of available line types can be selected.

section.title: Stroke Colour
section.p: By selecting the stroke colour, a palette of colours is displayed to choose from. On the right hand slide of the colour selector are predefined standard colours. Choose a colour by simply clicking the mouse on the required colour.
By pressing the X on the top right of the colour selector widget or clicking on the colour selector widget again will leave the previously selected colour unchanged.

section.title: Marker Start/End
section.p: Two ToolItems located after the stroke-colour picker, by default represented by a blank line; allow you to select various UML and Flowchart or general markers, for use with your lines and paths

Every line or path created will have selected marker-head or marker-start that is currently selected in this widget set to it. Setting the ToolItems back to the default blank line, will result in line/paths being created without a marker-end or marker-start

Markers can be changed on existing line by first selecting the line, then setting the marker selection with these ToolItems Selecting a path/line with a marker, will display the marker(s) set to it in these ToolItems
There are two shortcuts, located to the left of the marker start/end items, used to quickly set the markers to a default blank line, or to a standard filled arrow.
